intro: Borreria egleri, commonly known as the Mexican red root, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a smooth or slightly hairy texture. Borreria egleri is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
